definition: from door to door, one by one
in order/in sequence/close to/adjacent to
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

see 挨家挨戶|挨家挨户[ai1 jia1 ai1 hu4]

sentences.english: He begged from door to door.

sentences.chinese: 丽丽是我门挨门的邻居。

sentences.english: They often went carolling at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 他们在圣诞节时常去挨门挨户地唱圣诞颂歌。

sentences.english: From door to door you were always hoping for the absolute best treats around.
sentences.chinese: 挨门挨户你总是希望把最好的绝对左右。

sentences.english: They are looking for the dog from door to door .
sentences.chinese: 他们正在挨门挨户地找那条狗。

sentences.english: He makes a living by begging from door to door.
sentences.chinese: 他靠挨门挨户乞讨为生。

sentences.english: Peddling indicates the selling of small , inexpensive goods by going from house to house .
sentences.chinese: 叫卖指挨门挨户地推销廉价的小商品。

sentences.english: Julia ran to every room, telling them there was a fire.
sentences.chinese: 茱莉亚挨门挨房地告知里面的人医院里着了火。
